intro: Humboltia meridana, commonly known as the desert nightshade, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are edible but contain toxic compounds. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, and it blooms at night, attracting specific pollinators. Humboltia meridana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for wildlife and contributing to soil stability.
